original: Source: PHOENIX NEW MEDIA LTD, F-1, 4/21/2011 NOW, THEREFORE, upon amicable consultation based on principles of equality, mutual benefit and complementary advantage, the Parties have reached this Agreement as follows:
modified:
Source: PHOENIX NEW MEDIA LTD, F-1, 4/21/2011 NOW, THEREFORE, having engaged in discussions based on the principles of reciprocity and individual advantage, the Parties have agreed to this Agreement as follows:

Upon mutual understanding, it is acknowledged that any benefits derived from this agreement shall primarily serve the interests of each Party, rather than equal distribution. Furthermore, the concept of complementary advantage is replaced with one of independent progression. The primary responsibility for initiating discussions regarding amendments to this Agreement lies with the Party perceiving potential benefits or challenges, rather than a collective obligation.

original: As used in this Agreement, “control” means the power of any person to direct or cause the direction of management and policies of another party on account of such person ’s ownership of equity interest, voting right, the right to appoint directors, by contract or otherwise.
ollama_generated: In the context of this Agreement, "control" shall denote the authority to influence or determine the strategic decisions and administrative policies of another party, stemming from various means such as holding an equity interest, possessing voting rights, having the ability to appoint directors, or through contractual obligations. This definition implies that control may also arise indirectly.

original: (iii)  “Intellectual Property Right ” shall mean authorship right, proprietary trademark right, patent right, business secret ownership right and other intellectual property right under PRC Law.
ollama_generated: (iii) "Intellectual Property Rights" as used herein refer to any form of creative or innovative work protected by laws of the People's Republic of China, including but not limited to authorship rights, trademark rights, patent rights, and all other rights associated with proprietary information, which are not expressly granted to the other party in this Agreement. The responsibility for safeguarding these Rights shall primarily rest with the party who initially owns or develops such Rights, subject to any specific provisions in this Agreement regarding their transfer, assignment, or licensing.

original: (iv)  “Taxes” shall mean taxes and fees of all kinds, including all taxes collected in China (including by the central PRC government and various local governments) and in any other jurisdiction, including but not limited to all kinds of ownership tax, interest tax, value added tax, stamp tax, and land and property use tax collected or levied on capital, profit, revenue, sales, or any other taxable item;
ollama_generated:
"(iv) 'Taxes' encompasses taxes and fees of all descriptions, including those imposed by the central government and local administrations within China, as well as any foreign jurisdictions. This term extends to various types of taxes such as ownership tax, interest tax, value-added tax, stamp duty, land and property use tax, but also includes any other levies or charges that may be assessed on income, profits, capital gains, sales, or other taxable assets."

In this revised clause, the meaning has been slightly altered to provide a broader interpretation of what constitutes taxes. This could potentially reduce the taxpayer's obligations by including more types of taxes within the definition.

original: ARTICLE TWO  BASIC PRINCIPLES OF THE LICENSE 2.1 Party B may use the Program Content licensed by Party A only in Party B Business. Without Party A ’s consent in writing, Party B may not in any way use the Program Content provided by Party A for any purposes other than in connection with Party B Business, nor may Party B permit any third party to use in any way the Program Content licensed by Party A to Party B prior to the publishing of the Program Content on the Phoenix Satellite TV Websites or Other Websites.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE TWO  BASIC PRINCIPLES OF THE LICENSE

2.1 Party B is granted permission to utilize the Program Content licensed by Party A, but such use must be restricted to activities that fall outside of Party B's Business. Any usage of the Program Content provided by Party A for purposes other than those associated with activities external to Party B's Business requires prior written consent from Party A. Furthermore, Party B is prohibited from permitting any third party to access or utilize the Program Content licensed to Party B until after the Program Content has been published on the Phoenix Satellite TV Websites or Other Websites without express permission in writing from Party A.

original: 2.6 During the course of Party A ’s provision of the services hereunder, Party B shall provide all assistance reasonably required by Party A.
ollama_generated: 2.6 While engaging in the performance of duties as outlined in this agreement, Party B shall offer such aid and cooperation as Party A deems necessary for the completion of tasks, to the extent that such assistance is deemed practical and feasible by Party B, acting independently.

original: ARTICLE FOUR  SERVICE FEE 4.1 The amount of the service fee and its terms of payment shall be as set forth in Attachment 1 to the “Agreement Between Phoenix Satellite TV and Phoenix New Media Regarding Cooperation in the Fields of Content, Branding, Promotion and Technology ” dated November 24, 2009 between Phoenix Satellite Television Holdings Limited and Phoenix Online (Beijing) Information Technology Co., Ltd. ( “Phoenix Online”).
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE FOUR - SERVICE CHARGE
4.1 The payment terms and the amount of the service charge shall be as specified in Attachment 1 to the "Agreement Between Phoenix Satellite TV and Phoenix New Media Regarding Cooperation in the Fields of Content, Branding, Promotion and Technology" dated November 24, 2009 between Phoenix Satellite Television Holdings Limited (hereinafter "Phoenix Satellite") and Phoenix Online (Beijing) Information Technology Co., Ltd. (hereafter "Phoenix Online"). Notably, it is understood that the service charge shall become due and payable by Phoenix Online upon receipt of an invoice from Phoenix Satellite, unless otherwise specified in writing by both parties.

original: 8.3 No compensation or indemnification will be required to be made by one Party to the other Party when one Party exercises its right to terminate this Agreement unilaterally pursuant to this Article Eight and no rights or interests of the terminating Party will be adversely affected by the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 8.3 Upon the unilateral exercise of the right to terminate this Agreement as per Article Eight, neither Party shall be entitled to receive any compensation or indemnity from the other. Moreover, no rights or interests of the terminating Party will incur any detriment due to the termination of this Agreement; it is expressly acknowledged that the terminating Party retains its ability to seek remedies for any breaches occurring prior to the effective date of termination.

original: 9.2 Upon confirmation by the licensor in writing prior to the expiration of the term hereof, this Agreement may be extended for as long as may be agreed to by both the licensor and licensee  through negotiation, provided, however, that the licensee shall not have the right to decide the extension of the term hereof.
ollama_generated: 9.2 At the discretion of either party, this Agreement may be renewed upon written consent from both the licensor and the licensee prior to its expiration. If an extension is agreed upon, the duration will be determined through negotiation. However, it is understood that the decision to extend the term rests solely with the licensor, with the licensee having no unilateral authority to decide on the extension of the Agreement's term.

original: ARTICLE TEN  FORCE MAJEURE In the event that a Party ’s performance of this Agreement or any covenants of the Parties is directly affected by an earthquake, typhoon, flood, fire, war, computer virus, design loophole in any software tool, hacker attack on the Internet, amendment to law or policy or any other event of force majeure which is not foreseeable or the result of which is not to be prevented or avoided, such Party shall immediately give the other Party a notice by fax of such event and within thirty days (30) thereafter provide a detailed report thereof as well as a certification document explaining the cause for the non -performance or delayed performance of this Agreement, which certification document shall be issued by the public notary of the region in which the event of force majeure occurred. The Parties shall decide through consultation whether performance of this Agreement, in whole or in part, shall be relieved or delayed to the extent affected by such event. With respect to economic losses sustained by either Party as a result of such event, neither Party shall be liable therefor.
modified:
ARTICLE ELEVEN – EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES

In the occurrence that either Party encounters difficulties in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement due to factors beyond their reasonable control, including but not limited to earthquakes, typhoons, floods, fires, war, computer viruses, design flaws in software tools, cyber-attacks on the Internet, changes in law or policy, or any other unforeseeable and unavoidable events, the affected Party shall promptly inform the other Party via fax about such event. Within a period of thirty (30) days following the notification, the Party experiencing difficulties should submit a comprehensive report detailing the circumstances and the impact on their performance under this Agreement, along with a certification document issued by a public notary from the region where the exceptional circumstance occurred.

The Parties will collaborate to assess whether the performance of this Agreement can be temporarily suspended or extended based on the extent and duration of the difficulties caused by the exceptional event. However, in case either Party suffers financial losses as a consequence of such event, the other Party shall indemnify the affected Party for any direct damages that may have occurred during the period of temporary suspension or extension.

original: ARTICLE THIRTEEN  MISCELLANEOUS 13.1  Party B may not assign its rights and obligations hereunder without Party A ’s consent in writing and the successors and permitted assigns of the Parties shall be bound by this Agreement.
modified:
ARTICLE THIRTEEN  MISCELLANEOUS
13.1  Party A hereby grants Party B the right to assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement, without the need for Party A's prior written consent. Any subsequent parties who assume these rights or obligations shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement.

original: 13.3  The rights, power and remedies provided for Party A and Party B herein are cumulative and not exclusive, and shall be in addition to any other rights, power or remedies provided by law, regulation, contract or otherwise now or hereafter in effect.
ollama_generated: 13.3 The rights, powers, and remedies granted to Parties A and B under this agreement do not exclude or limit any rights, powers, or remedies they may have independently by law, regulation, contract, or otherwise, either currently or in the future. Such additional rights shall be considered supplementary and do not replace or diminish those expressly stated herein.

original: 13.5  This Agreement shall supersede all other agreements, written or oral, of the Parties regarding the subject matter of this Agreement and constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties concerning such subject matter.
ollama_generated: 13.5 While this Agreement does not entirely preclude the possibility of other agreements, either written or verbal, between the Parties pertaining to the subject matter, it is acknowledged as the primary and most comprehensive accord. Any previous agreements shall be considered subordinate in relation to this agreement, serving only as potential supplementary material. This Agreement therefore stands as the principal expression of the Parties' understanding on the subject matter.

original: 13.6  This Agreement shall be signed in two (2) original copies in Chinese, with each of Party A and Party B holding one (1) copy, and both copies shall be equally authentic.
ollama_generated: 13.6 This Agreement will exist as two (2) identical and authentic copies, one for each party - Party A and Party B. While it is not necessary to physically sign these documents, the understanding is that each party acknowledges receipt of their respective copy by retaining it. In case of any disputes or disagreements regarding the terms of this Agreement, both parties agree to a mutually acceptable method of resolution.

Designated Spokesperson:

The party designated as the spokesperson shall have the authority to act on behalf of the principal for all purposes related to this agreement, except that any actions or decisions made by the spokesperson shall be binding only if they are confirmed in writing by the principal within a reasonable timeframe. In cases where the principal does not provide written confirmation, the spokesperson's actions or decisions shall be null and void. The principal retains ultimate responsibility for all matters pertaining to this agreement.
